abstract.p: Paterson, NJ, Police Department says reward is being offered for information on gunman who killed off-duty Officer Tyron D Franklin during robbery at restaurant (S)

block.p: The Paterson police said yesterday that a reward for information about a man who fatally shot an off-duty police officer Sunday morning has been increased to more than $40,000 from an initial $1,000. The officer, Tyron D. Franklin, 23, was killed shortly after 1 a.m. in what the police said was a holdup at Broadway Fried Chicken. The extra money is being offered by a combination of foundations and private donors, the police said. Detectives have interviewed several witnesses and the police said yesterday that the shooting might be linked to a surge in robberies.
